definition: to string together/to skewer/to connect wrongly/to gang up/to rove/string/bunch/skewer/classifier for things that are strung together, or in a bunch, or in a row: string of, bunch of, series of/to make a swift or abrupt linear movement (like a bead on an abacus)/to move across
thread/string/wire/line/CL:條|条[tiao2],股[gu3],根[gen1]/(after a number) tier (unofficial ranking of a Chinese city)

sentences.english: Our line seems to have got cross with someone else 's.
sentences.chinese: 好像我們的線路跟別人的串線了。

sentences.english: Your time will either cross or be crossed.
sentences.chinese: 你的時間是可以交叉或和別人的串線了。

sentences.english: Love is a telephone which often has crossed lines.
sentences.chinese: 愛情是一部電話，它常常串線。

sentences.english: Fortunately, all such occurrences are transient.
sentences.chinese: 幸運的是，每一次串線都是暫時的。

sentences.english: Fortunately, all such occurrences are transient8.

sentences.english: Bothcasesare refereed to as "triangles". Fortunately, all suchoccurrencesare transient.

sentences.english: The connection is too bad. We must have gotten our lines crossed.
sentences.chinese: 通話情況太糟了，我們的線路一定和別人的串線了。

sentences.english: We must have gotten our lines crossed.
